basics.name: John Headland
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science with a focus in Security Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2018.

work.summary: Teaching programming to middle to high school students.
highlights: Lead instruction with a fellow teacher for multiple classes

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa Math Department
work.summary: Assisted in the instruction of a Precalculus MATH134 class.
highlights: Demonstrate mathematical techniques in teacher's absence
Helped the teacher with grading and administration of tests
Attended MATH134 classes twice a week to assist students

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa ICS Department
work.summary: Studied and optimized the cost and runtime of digital circuits under Dr. Peter Michael-Seidel
highlights: Studied the simulation of digital circuits using the Logisim program
Optimized the runtime of digital circuits with Vivado software
Researched cost/time efficient circuitry currently used in upper-division classes

work.summary: Performed the duties of a Certified Nursing Assistant
highlights: Shadowed doctors and nurses in various wards/clinics and departments
Provided personal patient care in Physical & Occupational Therapy

awards.title: College of Natural Sciences Dean's List
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii at Manoa College of Natural Sciences

awards.title: Hawaii Rotary Youth Foundation Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to a Hawaii high school senior.

awards.title: 1st Place HOSA State Competition in Physical Therapy
awards.summary: Won 1st place in the state competition for demonstrating physical therapy knowledge and skills. Competed at national level.
